intro: Psychotria bimea, commonly known as the red Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria bimea is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
